tool.name: SAGA.grid_tools.15
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayINPUT False isArrayRETAB False isArrayRETAB_2 False isArrayF_MIN False isArrayF_MAX False isArrayF_CODE False output_data_RESULT $output_data_RESULT name SAGA.grid_tools.15 INPUT $INPUT METHOD $METHOD OLD $OLD NEW $NEW SOPERATOR $SOPERATOR MIN $MIN MAX $MAX RNEW $RNEW ROPERATOR $ROPERATOR RETAB $RETAB TOPERATOR $TOPERATOR RETAB_2 $RETAB_2 F_MIN $F_MIN F_MAX $F_MAX F_CODE $F_CODE NODATAOPT $NODATAOPT NODATA $NODATA OTHEROPT $OTHEROPT OTHERS $OTHERS RESULT_NODATA_CHOICE $RESULT_NODATA_CHOICE RESULT_NODATA_VALUE $RESULT_NODATA_VALUE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_RESULT $OutputSection_RESULT.outputType_RESULT transmissionMode_RESULT $OutputSection_RESULT.transmissionMode_RESULT

param.name: INPUT
param.label: Grid
param.help: Grid to reclassify The following data types are allowed in the txt file: png, x-ogc-envi, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: METHOD
param.label: Method
param.help: Select the desired method: 1. a single value or a range defined by a single value is reclassified, 2. a range of values is reclassified, 3. the lookup table is used to reclassify the grid.

param.name: OLD
param.label: old value
param.help: Value to reclassify.

param.name: NEW
param.label: new value
param.help: New value.

param.name: SOPERATOR
param.label: operator
param.help: Select the desired operator (<;.;=; >;.); it is possible to define a range above or below the old value.

param.name: MIN
param.label: minimum value
param.help: Minimum value of the range to be reclassified.

param.name: MAX
param.label: maximum value
param.help: Maximum value of the range to be reclassified.

param.name: RNEW
param.label: new value
param.help: new value

param.name: ROPERATOR
param.label: operator
param.help: Select operator: eg. min < value < max.

param.name: RETAB
param.label: Lookup Table
param.help: Lookup table used in method "table" The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: TOPERATOR
param.label: operator
param.help: Select the desired operator (min < value < max; min . value < max; min .value . max; min < value . max).

param.name: RETAB_2
param.label: Lookup Table
param.help: Lookup table used in method "user supplied table" The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: F_MIN
param.label: minimum value
param.help: minimum value The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: F_MAX
param.label: maximum value
param.help: maximum value The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: F_CODE
param.label: new value
param.help: new value The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: NODATAOPT
param.label: no data values
param.help: Use this option to reclassify No-Data values independently of the method settings.

param.name: NODATA
param.label: new value
param.help: new value

param.name: OTHEROPT
param.label: other values
param.help: Use this option to reclassify all other values that are not specified in the options above.

param.name: OTHERS
param.label: new value
param.help: new value

param.name: RESULT_NODATA_CHOICE
param.label: Assign ...
param.help: Choose how to handle the NoData value of the output grid.

param.name: RESULT_NODATA_VALUE
param.label: NoData Value
param.help: User defined NoData value for output grid.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_RESULT
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

param.name: outputType_RESULT
param.label: Reclassified Grid
param.help: Reclassified grid.

tool.help: The tool can be used to reclassify the values of a grid. It provides three different options:<br/>(a) reclassification of single values<br/>(b) reclassification of a range of values<br/>(c) reclassification of value ranges specified in a lookup table<br/><br/>In addition to these methods, two special cases (NoData values and values not included in the reclassification setup) are supported.<br/>With reclassification mode (a) and (b), the 'NoData option' is evaluated before the 'Method' settings. In reclassification mode (c) the option is evaluated only if the NoData value is not included in the lookup table.<br/>The 'other values' option is always evaluated after checking the 'Method' settings.<br/><br/>The tool allows one to define the NoData value of the output grid (header): by default, the output grid gets assigned the NoData value of the input grid. But it is also possible to assign a user defined NoData value.<br/><br/>
